ygData.authorName: I'm on a road to nowhere ...
ygData.subject: RE: Yield Policy
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hi, Ralph.  I *do* agree with you, that this is a step to make the game more fair for those who don t powerlevel and run up their characters. And I do
ygData.messageBody:
On Sun, 12 Sep 1999, Ralph wrote:

> From: "Ralph" <carothersr@...>
>
> it IS the point....you look at it as discrimination.
>

Hi, Ralph. I *do* agree with you, that this is a step to make the game
more fair for those who don't powerlevel and run up their characters.
And I do think Mikaela (Hi, Mik!) is, for lack of a better term,
misrepresenting the case of the higher-levels. There is no easy
solution to the case of higher-levels bullying their way into an area,
and Verant is simply trying to come up with a solution that, if unfair,
is at least the least unfair of solutions.

> I truly hope
> that Verant goes and codes in "green cons give SQUAT" so you all can shut up
> and leave, or stay and play and stop whining.

Ralph, we're all on this list because we in theory enjoy the game, and
enjoy playing clerics; I understand that you might be frustrated that
someone disagrees with you - it's always a shock to have someone just
come out and say "you're wrong in my lights 'cause of ...". But that's
no reason to be petulant. Take a deep breath and remember that we are
basically here to have fun; snapping at people who have no real impact
on the code of the game only serves to heighten tensions.

Smile. Have fun. Go heal a newbie with Greater Heal and watch their
eyes light up. =)
--
"I would not mind you in my head," Lews Therin said, sounding almost
sane, "if you were not so clearly mad."
